result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle B. Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 11:49am [ma]
Defendant Danielle B. Kramer in court with attorney Karl E Huebner.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 and uncharged read in: 16JE529 dov: 2/26/16 referral for domestic violence disorderly conduct and bal jumping.

Sentencing argument given by ADA Hall

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Darrell Pryor, unless both he and Agent agree
--no possession of any dangerous weapon 
--complete certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--no acts or threats of violence
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharge



Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:12:00pm
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO IMPEACH THE DEFENDANT WITH PRIOR CONVICTIONS/ADJUDICATIONS

Case called at 10:45am [ma]
Defendant Danielle B. Kramer in court with attorney Karl E Huebner.  Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense indicates prepared for Trial; State indicates that was understanding case would resolve, needs time to file pretrial motions (Motion to Impeach with Priors and Motion to Admit Statements)
Atty. Huebner indicates that there are no Miranda/Goodchild issues within Discovery, therefore no need to schedule hearing.
The Court will allow the State to file Pretrial Motions by eob tomorrow

The Court and Counsel agree:
--1 alternate
--4 strikes per side
--Jurors allowed to ask questions and take notes
--Jury to be ready at 8:45am
--Parties to be in court at 8:30am
recess: 10:49am 

NEXT: Jury Trial to remain as scheduled

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] case called at 2:39pm. 
Defendant Danielle B. Kramer in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ discloses that she did previously represent Ms. Kramer. DA Happ is aware that this hearing will be scheduling in nature, however she can arrange for an Assistant DA to come appear for the State today if Ms. Kramer wishes. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is fine to proceed with DA Happ appearing today. 
Attorney Huebner indicates that the case should be set for trial. 
The Court continues Bail and conditions as fixed. 
recess 2:41pm.

Pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court extends time limits ten days for requesting substitution of judge and for requesting speedy trial;  if speedy trial is not requested within ten days, then speedy trial rights are waived by the Defendant.

--no discussion of the case with Darrell Pryor
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence toward anyone
